intro: Lapsana communis subsp. pinnatisecta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cudweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a feathery appearance, and it produces small yellow flowers in the summer. The species is often found in open habitats and is considered a common weed in agricultural areas.
